segment.source: MD Microsoft Intune Service Description
segment.target: MD Microsoft Intune Service Description

segment.source: MD Microsoft Intune Service Description
segment.target: MD Microsoft Intune Service Description

segment.source: Learn about the service and find additional technical documentation for Intune.
segment.target: Learn about the service and find additional technical documentation for Intune.

segment.source: Service Description
segment.target: Service Description

segment.source: is a cloud-based service that helps you manage Windows PCs, and iOS, Android, and Windows mobile devices.
segment.target: is a cloud-based service that helps you manage Windows PCs, and iOS, Android, and Windows mobile devices.

segment.source: Intune also helps protect corporate applications and data.
segment.target: Intune also helps protect corporate applications and data.

segment.source: You can use Intune alone or you can integrate it with System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager to extend your management capabilities.
segment.target: You can use Intune alone or you can integrate it with System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager to extend your management capabilities.

segment.source: Microsoft offers the Onboarding benefit for eligible services in eligible plans.
segment.target: Microsoft offers the Onboarding benefit for eligible services in eligible plans.

segment.source: The Onboarding benefit lets you work remotely with Microsoft specialists to get your environment ready for use.
segment.target: The Onboarding benefit lets you work remotely with Microsoft specialists to get your environment ready for use.

segment.source: For more information, see Microsoft Intune Onboarding Benefit Description.
segment.target: For more information, see Microsoft Intune Onboarding Benefit Description.

segment.source: You can start using with a 30-day free trial that includes 100 user licenses.
segment.target: You can start using with a 30-day free trial that includes 100 user licenses.

segment.source: To start your free trial, click here to visit the Intune Sign up page.
segment.target: To start your free trial, click here to visit the Intune Sign up page.

segment.source: If your organization has an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement, please contact your Microsoft representative to set up your free trial.
segment.target: If your organization has an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement, please contact your Microsoft representative to set up your free trial.

segment.source: If your organization has a Microsoft Online Services work or school account, and you might continue with this subscription in production after the trial period ends, then you should click the Sign in option on that page and authenticate by using the Global Administrator account for your organization.
segment.target: If your organization has a Microsoft Online Services work or school account, and you might continue with this subscription in production after the trial period ends, then you should click the Sign in option on that page and authenticate by using the Global Administrator account for your organization.

segment.source: This action will ensure that your trial links to your existing work or school account.
segment.target: This action will ensure that your trial links to your existing work or school account.

segment.source: For a list of settings that you can configure on mobile devices, see:
segment.target: For a list of settings that you can configure on mobile devices, see:

segment.source: Mobile device management capabilities in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Mobile device management capabilities in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: General settings for Mobile Devices in Configuration Manager
segment.target: General settings for Mobile Devices in Configuration Manager

segment.source: For information on System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, see Documentation Library for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For information on System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, see Documentation Library for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Understand how Intune service updates affect you
segment.target: Understand how Intune service updates affect you

segment.source: Because is an online service, Microsoft can update it on a regular basis.
segment.target: Because is an online service, Microsoft can update it on a regular basis.

segment.source: Use the information in this topic to help you understand the frequency of these service updates, and the advance notification we give to you when an update might affect your use of the service.
segment.target: Use the information in this topic to help you understand the frequency of these service updates, and the advance notification we give to you when an update might affect your use of the service.

segment.source: To learn about changes in the service, see What's new in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: To learn about changes in the service, see What's new in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: The Microsoft Intune Blog also discusses changes in the service, and provides helpful tips to enable you to get the most from .
segment.target: The Microsoft Intune Blog also discusses changes in the service, and provides helpful tips to enable you to get the most from .

segment.source: Additionally, important service updates will be communicated to you directly from the console in the notice board.
segment.target: Additionally, important service updates will be communicated to you directly from the console in the notice board.

segment.source: Use this table to understand how Microsoft communicates details of service changes.
segment.target: Use this table to understand how Microsoft communicates details of service changes.

segment.source: Category of change
segment.target: Category of change

segment.target: More information

segment.target: Communication window

segment.source: Stay up to date
segment.target: Stay up to date

segment.source: Information about new features
segment.target: Information about new features

segment.source: New functionality, or enhancements to existing features
segment.target: New functionality, or enhancements to existing features

segment.source: Included in our monthly service update.
segment.target: Included in our monthly service update.

segment.source: Generally, Microsoft rolls out service updates around the middle of each month.
segment.target: Generally, Microsoft rolls out service updates around the middle of each month.

segment.source: Updates are described in What's new in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Updates are described in What's new in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Plan for change
segment.target: Plan for change

segment.source: Updates that might have compliance or regulatory impact
segment.target: Updates that might have compliance or regulatory impact

segment.source: Changes to the user experience, user interface, and workflows
segment.target: Changes to the user experience, user interface, and workflows

segment.source: New, or changed APIs – Notifying you that you need to test to ensure backward compatibility of custom apps
segment.target: New, or changed APIs – Notifying you that you need to test to ensure backward compatibility of custom apps

segment.source: Changes to system requirements, for example, the minimum required browser version
segment.target: Changes to system requirements, for example, the minimum required browser version

segment.source: Any updates that require you to take action to enable the feature or to avoid service interruption to the feature.
segment.target: Any updates that require you to take action to enable the feature or to avoid service interruption to the feature.

segment.source: At least 30-90 days prior to the service upgrade, depending on the impact of the change .
segment.target: At least 30-90 days prior to the service upgrade, depending on the impact of the change .

segment.source: This will happen using in-product communication channels like notice board alerts.
segment.target: This will happen using in-product communication channels like notice board alerts.

segment.source: Intune service retirement
segment.target: Intune service retirement

segment.source: Retirement of the service
segment.target: Retirement of the service

segment.source: At least 12 months
segment.target: At least 12 months

segment.source: Choose the management solution that’s right for you
segment.target: Choose the management solution that’s right for you

segment.source: You can configure in a number of ways to manage and help protect your company's mobile devices and computers (referred to as devices in this document).
segment.target: You can configure in a number of ways to manage and help protect your company's mobile devices and computers (referred to as devices in this document).

segment.source: stand-alone configuration.
segment.target: stand-alone configuration.

segment.source: Use the web-based administration console in to manage devices in your organization.
segment.target: Use the web-based administration console in to manage devices in your organization.

segment.source: can be used without any on-premises IT infrastructure, but if you use with Active Directory Domain Services, you can use domain user accounts that you manage with Domain Services with .
segment.target: can be used without any on-premises IT infrastructure, but if you use with Active Directory Domain Services, you can use domain user accounts that you manage with Domain Services with .

segment.source: with System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: with System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Use the management console to manage computers and mobile devices in your enterprise.
segment.target: Use the management console to manage computers and mobile devices in your enterprise.

segment.source: This configuration can help you to manage all of your organization’s devices through a single console, the Admin Console.
segment.target: This configuration can help you to manage all of your organization’s devices through a single console, the Admin Console.

segment.source: supports very large numbers of mobile devices, servers and computers.
segment.target: supports very large numbers of mobile devices, servers and computers.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Manage Mobile Devices by Using Configuration Manager and Microsoft Intune in the Documentation Library for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Manage Mobile Devices by Using Configuration Manager and Microsoft Intune in the Documentation Library for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For more help deciding which approach is right for you, see Deleted topic
segment.target: For more help deciding which approach is right for you, see Deleted topic

segment.source: Mobile device management provided by Office 365, as described in Ways to do enterprise mobility
segment.target: Mobile device management provided by Office 365, as described in Ways to do enterprise mobility
